Class Details



[line 65]

This is Oriented Object Template engine.

How it works:  ...
Usage:  First you should create a new instance of OOTemplate class,  this object contein a OOTemplate_Context object, you will set
Sample code:
  1.  <?php
    2. 

  2.  ini_set ('include_path',
    3. 

  3.    ini_get ('include_path').':'.dirname (__FILE__).'/../lib:');
    4. 

  4.  
    5. 

  5.  require 'OOTemplate.php';
    6. 

  6.  
    7. 

  7.  $t = new OOTemplate ('<html>Hello {% if who %} {{ who }} {% endif %}</html>');
    8. 

  8.  $t->render ();
    9. 

  9.  
    10. 

  10.  // output:
    11. 

  11.  // <html>Hello </html>
    12. 

  12.  
    13. 

  13.  $c = $t->getContext ();
    14. 

  14.  $c->who = 'World';
    15. 

  15.  $t->render ();
    16. 

  16.  
    17. 

  17.  // output:
    18. 

  18.  
    19.

$context, iterable|string
